text: <@UU9U51TJ6> mind following up on the above?

Hi <@UU34NMHJB> and <@U7KKA4QQM>, I can reproduce this on my end, so taking a closer look.

Image fields are still available for theme fields (in fields.json file), not just modules, seen in <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/themes#fields-json|this doc>. I’ll follow up here as soon as I’ve got more!
<@U6GNQ7JBU> - have a few questions on this
can I book some time with you?
Thank you, let us know when you know something it is concerning. :slightly_smiling_face:
<@UU34NMHJB> and <@U7KKA4QQM>, this should be fixed now. Let me know if you’re still seeing this behavior

Hey Jonathan, shoot me your questions and I will answer as quickly as I can. Several of us HubSpotters, Matt Coley, AJ and I included will be doing an AMA soon so we may not be able to respond until after.
It is indeed fixed!  Thank you!
the `password_prompt` module input is the only HubSpot form field that doesn't have an `hs-input` class on it. Could we add that class to it?
I’ve removed a module locally and run `hs watch <src> <dest> --remove` but it is still in the deployed version. How do I get HubSpot to remove files I’ve deleted locally?
cant you add it to the module `extra_classes` attribute
<@U01226478B0> i think --remove has to come before src
I’ll give it a try, thanks

<@UU9U51TJ6> Update: the field is there, but if I go to change the image I'm met with "there was a problem loading this content" and the entire theme editor goes kaput.  Only realizing this now because I hadn't tried to change the image before.
I’m seeing that as well on my end, <@UU34NMHJB>. Taking a look
It’s already being looked at. Should have a fix soon!
